intro: Galium chersonense, commonly known as the Cherson thimbleweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that disperses seeds by wind. Galium chersonense is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks.
